projects.title: Web-Based Chess Engine
descriptions: A group project for our software engineering course over a semester-long period.
Created interactive chess board, and UIs for pawn promotion and color selection.
Developed logical checks for valid moves while connecting our custom chess engine with the front-end chess board.
Built a complete site around the chess board.

projects.title: Personal Website React Application
descriptions: My first project learning about front-end frameworks, meant to be updated as I built more things.
Developed completely with ReactJS and TailwindCSS.
Used some additional React packages such as React-Typed and React-Scroll.

projects.title: YouTube Metadata Machine Learning Research Project
descriptions: Addressed the challenge online creators face with trying to find success on YouTube.
Used predictive modeling techniques such as regression and classification to identify key factors of success.
Created a research poster and two-page abstract detailing our findings.

projects.title: Phishing Website: Spear Phishing Project
descriptions: Course project where I had to take on the role of an attacker trying to steal credentials.
Exploited GitHub by phishing users with a fake login page identical to the real thing.
Created spear-phishing attempts through emails specified at GitHub users.

WIPs.title: Discord Bot: A Small Community Server Bot
WIPs.description: Currently working on core functionality of the bot. Its main purpose will be to manage polling, authentication, and small games.

WIPs.title: College Club Watch Party Web Application
WIPs.description: Project currently on pause for the summer. The main purpose of this web application is to have an easily accessible tool for the club to search for shows and add them into a list to be randomized for weekly watch parties.
